Speaker: A
Text: Hey, did you finish reading that article I sent you yesterday?

Speaker: B
Text: Yeah, I read it this morning. It was more interesting than I expected.

Speaker: A
Text: Same here—I didn’t think the results would be that strong.

Speaker: B
Text: Especially the part about how small changes had such a big effect.

Speaker: A
Text: Right? It makes me rethink how we designed our own study.

Speaker: B
Text: I was thinking the same thing. We might need an extra control condition.

Speaker: A
Text: That would mean more participants, though. Do we have the budget for that?

Speaker: B
Text: Probably not, but we could shorten the sessions to compensate.

Speaker: A
Text: That’s a good idea. It might even reduce participant fatigue.

Speaker: B
Text: Agreed. Let’s bring it up at the meeting tomorrow.
